intro: Euplassa itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia euplassa, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, forested areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
